report_title: Industry Research: Landscaping & Gardening Franchises in the US
executive_summary: The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic has created the ideal environment of increased time spent outdoors, disposable income and spending on home improvements for the Landscaping and Gardening Franchises industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for landscaping and gardening services is tied to the commercial and residential property markets. During most of the current period, growth in the residential and commercial property markets has increased demand for industry services. Moreover, surging housing starts and the rise in the value of residential construction has enabled increased investment in landscaping and gardening services by residential markets. Rising disposable income over the past five years has also benefited the industry. However, demand from the commercial market lagged during the coronavirus pandemic, as corporate profit fell and investment in nonresidential structures was limited. This trend resulted in a deceleration of industry revenue growth during the latter years of the period.

Although the industry has benefited from rising disposable income, it has also experienced heightened competition due to the low barriers to entry in the industry as well as in competitor industries such as the Landscaping Services industry. Franchisees can expect initial investments in the range of $50,000 to $100,000 for top franchisors such as Lawn Doctor and US Lawns. These start-up costs are significantly higher than non-franchise landscaping business costs. Nonetheless, high initial costs have not deterred entrance to the industry, with the number of establishments rising an annualized 3.8% over the past five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Landscaping and Gardening Franchises industry is anticipated to experience sustained demand over the five years to 2027, with revenue rising an annualized 2.3% to reach $1.8 billion. Recovering demand from the nonresidential market is estimated to buoy demand for landscaping and gardening services. Moreover, per capita disposable income is anticipated to rise, benefiting industry operators. However, the value of residential construction is anticipated to fall, after surging during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

Despite sustained demand for industry services, industry profitability, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is estimated to fall to 7.5% of revenue in 2027, down from 8.0% in 2022. Rising wage costs and heightened competition are anticipated to limit industry profit over the next five years.

The industry is anticipated to embrace technology more than ever over the next five years, with little fear of worker displacement. Autonomous mowers will keep the turf maintained, freeing up workers to focus on more skilled tasks, such as pruning and plant diagnostics. Moreover, drones, online estimating tools, specialized business management software, and crew tracking apps are anticipated to provide increased productivity and accuracy. Nonetheless, wage costs are anticipated to continue to rise over the next five years, as operators raise wages to maintain their workforces. Wages are anticipated to reach 33.5% of revenue in 2027, up from 31.6% in 2022.

industry_definition: Industry establishments primarily provide landscape care and maintenance services, including installing plants, gardens, walkways, ponds and other similar structures.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: The pandemic has created the ideal environment of increased time spent outdoors, disposable income and spending on home improvements for the industry
Surging housing starts and the rise in the value of residential construction has enabled increased investment in landscaping and gardening services by residential markets
Although the industry has benefited from rising disposable income, it has also experienced heightened competition

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Government spending on the maintenance of parks, schools, hospitals, community centers and other public areas drives demand for services provided by this industry. Other niche services in this industry, such as tree pruning, benefit from government spending as well. As governments aim to balance their budgets, services provided by this industry could suffer. In 2022, government consumption and investment are expected to increase.

business_locations.location_description: Basis of Competition: HIGH competition, STEADY competition. Barriers to Entry: Not provided.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Estimated at 31.6% of industry revenue in 2022, wages comprise the second-largest cost segment for the industry. The majority of industry workers are hired to perform manual tasks, such as lawn mowing, tree and shrub pruning and turf installation.

Purchases of materials and equipment used to provide industry services are estimated to comprise 31.9% of industry revenue in 2022. Materials include soil, fertilizer, mulch, grass, turf and fabric, in addition to construction materials used for retaining walls such as rock and cement. More specialized purchases can include herbicide and pesticide or irrigation piping and equipment.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower. However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.
